text.0: boundless and wasting not the heavenly food of gods goes to the foeless one doer of wondrous deeds.
text.1: press out make ready offer gifts with special zeal to him whom many laud accepter of the prayer.
text.2: he who filled full his belly with the somas juice maghavan was delighted with the meaths sweet draught.
text.3: when uśanā that he might slay the monstrous beast gave him the mighty weapon with a thousand points.
text.4: illustrious is the man whoever presseth out soma for him in sunshine or in cloud and rain.
text.5: the mighty maghavan who is the sages friend advanceth more and more his beauteous progeny.
text.6: the strong god doth not flee away from him whose sire whose mother or whose brother he hath done to death.
text.7: he the avenger seeketh this mans offered gifts this god the source of riches doth not flee from sin.
text.8: he seeks no enterprise with five or ten to aid nor stays with him who pours no juice though prospering well.
text.9: the shaker conquers or slays in this way or that and to the pious gives a stable full of kine.
text.10: exceeding strong in war he stays the chariot wheel and hating him who pours not prospers him who pours.
text.11: indra the terrible tamer of every man as Ārya leads away the dāsa at his will.
text.12: he gathers up for plunder all the niggards gear excellent wealth he gives to him who offers gifts.
text.13: not even in wide stronghold may all the folk stand firm who have provoked to anger his surpassing might.
text.14: when indra maghavan hath marked two wealthy men fighting for beauteous cows with all their followers.
text.15: he who stirs all things takes one as his close ally and shaker with his heroes sends the kine to him.
text.16: agni i laud the liberal agnivesi satri the type and standard of the pious.
text.17: may the collected waters yield him plenty and his be powerful and bright dominion.
